Instance.description: Base class for Situation Goals that target a subset of sims at the Situation.

Tunable.name: _select_sims_outside_of_situation
Tunable.description: If true then when the goal system selects sims for the target the sims outside of the active situation can be chosen.

TunableEnum.name: _target_option
TunableEnum.description: How to apply the target tests. See design document for Event Goals

TunableList.name: _target_tests
TunableList.description: A set of tests that a sim must to be a target of this goal.

TunableVariant.description: A single tunable test.

TunableTuple.name: bucks_perks_test
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether or not a household or sim has a specific Bucks Perk unlocked.

Tunable.name: bucks_perk
Tunable.description: The specific Perk to check against.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the results of the test will be inverted. The truth table is as follows for sim with the perk: test_if_unlocked is true and invert is false: True test_if_unlocked is true and invert is true: False test_if_unlocked is false and invert is false: False test_if_unlocked is false and invert is true: True

TunableVariant.name: requires_same_club
TunableVariant.description:
When enabled it requires that the tuned target be in the associated club with the participant.
For example, this can be used to require that the participant and target be in the club associated with the secret handshake interaction and that the correct perk for that handshake is unlocked.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant that must also have the perk unlocked in a bucks tracker that they share in common with the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: test_if_unlocked
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will check to see if the specified Perk is unlocked. If unchecked, this test will check to see if the specified Perk is locked.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not a participant has or doesn't have specific buffs.

Tunable.name: apply_whitelist_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description: If checked, will require that each target has at least one whitelisted buff. If unchecked, will require only a single target to have at least one whitelisted trait.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: The Sim must not have any buff in this list to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, participant will test for buff's on the whitelist.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: The participant must have at least one buff in this list to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: career
TunableTuple.description:
Tunable test for what careers a Sim has.
subjects: A ParticipantType used for choosing whom to run the test on. test_type: A variant of the different tunable tests that handle testing for careers.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If this is true then it will negate the result of the test type. For instance if this is true and the test would return true for whether or not a sim has a particular career False will be returned instead.

TunableTuple.name: attended_first_day
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether or not the Sim has gone to work at all for the career.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career to see if the Sim has gone to work for.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: can_join_career
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether a sim can join a tunable number threshold of the tuned careers. This requires that the career be valid for the sim and that the sim not already be in the career.

TunableTuple.name: careers_to_consider
TunableTuple.description: The set of careers to consider and the threshold for passing.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableTuple.name: career_level
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the participants have a career at the specified level.

Tunable.name: career_level
Tunable.description: A reference to career level tuning that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableTuple.name: career_reference
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects have the specified career, career user level, or both.

Tunable.name: allow_invisible_careers
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will also allow non-visible careers (such as Odd Jobs) to tested against.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Should be called "Ignore List". Set of careers that will be ignored on the Sim. If the Sim only had these careers, it would be like having no careers.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: The career to test for on the Sim. When set by itself it will pass if the subject simply has this career. When set with user level it will only pass if the subjects user level passes the threshold test.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: career_track
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether the specified subjects have a career currently on the track specified.

Tunable.name: career_track
Tunable.description: A reference to the career track that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description: Interval test for the current user value of a career. Career track must also be specified for this check to work properly.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Interval test for the current user value of a career. Career track must also be specified for this check to work properly.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: common_career
TunableTuple.description: Test used to see if multiple participants have a career in common.

TunableList.name: targets
TunableList.description: tuning for the targets to check for the same common career on.

TunableTuple.name: career_level
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the participants have a career at the specified level.

Tunable.name: career_level
Tunable.description: A reference to career level tuning that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableTuple.name: career_reference
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects have the specified career, career user level, or both.

Tunable.name: allow_invisible_careers
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will also allow non-visible careers (such as Odd Jobs) to tested against.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Should be called "Ignore List". Set of careers that will be ignored on the Sim. If the Sim only had these careers, it would be like having no careers.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: The career to test for on the Sim. When set by itself it will pass if the subject simply has this career. When set with user level it will only pass if the subjects user level passes the threshold test.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: career_track
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether the specified subjects have a career currently on the track specified.

Tunable.name: career_track
Tunable.description: A reference to the career track that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description: Interval test for the current user value of a career. Career track must also be specified for this check to work properly.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Interval test for the current user value of a career. Career track must also be specified for this check to work properly.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: same_career_at_user_level
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the participants share any career that they have the same user level.

TunableTuple.name: user_level
TunableTuple.description: User level to test for.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: days_worked
TunableTuple.description: Test for how many days the Sim has worked for a career.

Tunable.name: active_only
Tunable.description: If checked, only workdays that the player has actively played will count.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career to test against.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Threshold test for days worked.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: has_available_assignment
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects has an available assignment in the specified career

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description:
The career to test for having an available assignment.
If None, will expect career passed in via PickedItemIds (i.e. via picker).

TunableTuple.name: has_career
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether or not the specified subjects have a career or not.

Tunable.name: has_career
Tunable.description: If true all subjects must have a career for the test to pass. If False then none of the subjects can have a career for the test to pass.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: has_career_outfit
TunableTuple.description: Test for if the subjects have a career outfit.

TunableTuple.name: has_quittable_career
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether or not the specified subjects have a quittable career or not.

Tunable.name: has_quittable_career
Tunable.description: If True then all of the subjects must have a quittable career in order for the test to pass. If False then none of the subjects can have a quittable career in order to pass.

TunableTuple.name: highest_level_achieved
TunableTuple.description: Test looking at the highest level ever achieved of a specific career.

TunableList.name: career_blacklist
TunableList.description: A set of careers that will not be looked at.

Tunable.description: The career we will not check.

TunableVariant.name: careers_to_check
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will only look at the careers listed in this. set. Otherwise will will look at all careers.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of careers that will be looked at.

Tunable.description: The career we will check.

Tunable.name: careers_to_find
Tunable.description: The number of careers that need to match the passing threshold for this test to pass.

TunableTuple.name: passing_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Threshold for determining if a career is considered passing for this test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: is_elective_course
TunableTuple.description: Test used to see if a career slot for a sim's university course is associated with an elective Univerity course.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career slot to test for associated elective course data on the subjects.

TunableTuple.name: is_retired
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether or not the specified subjects retired from a career.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The retired career to test for on the subjects. If left unset, the test will pass if the Sim is retired from any career.

TunableTuple.name: pto_amount
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects has the requested amount of PTO available in the specified career

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description:
The career to test for how much PTO the sim has.
If None, will expect career passed in via PickedItemIds (i.e. via picker).

TunableTuple.name: required_pto_available
TunableTuple.description: Threshold test for how much PTO is required

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: time_off
TunableTuple.description: Require a Sim to be in a career that does not have requested time off for the any reason.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: time_until_work
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects has the specified career, And that their next work day starts within the specified number of hours

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description:
The career to test the next start time of.
If None, will expect career passed in via PickedItemIds (i.e. via picker).

Tunable.name: check_all_careers
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check all careers rather than just the one defined in the career tunable. The test will fail if any career fails.

TunableTuple.name: hours_till_work
TunableTuple.description: Threshold test for how long 'till the "next" start time. It will test up to one hour past the start time, at which point it will test against the next start time.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: club
TunableTuple.description:
A tunable factory that tests against Clubs.
For use only with ClubSuperInteractions and ClubMixerInteractions.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_rule
TunableVariant.description: If set, then the affordance being tested (should one exist) must satisfy this rule requirement.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The rule requirement that the affordance must satisfy.

TunableVariant.name: club_status
TunableVariant.description: In enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either be or not be a member of this interaction's associated Club.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: In enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either be or not be a member of this interaction's associated Club.

TunableVariant.name: invite_only
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either be invite only or be open to everyone.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either be invite only or be open to everyone.

Tunable.name: pass_if_any_clubs_pass
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if any of the clubs match the requirements otherwise we require all clubs to meet the requirements.

TunableVariant.name: recent_member_status
TunableVariant.description: If specified, the Sim must satisfy recent member status requirements.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether or not the Sim must be a recent member of the Club in order to pass this test.

TunableVariant.name: require_common_club
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, then there must be a common Club that both the subject Sim and this specified Sim are in. If the club type is set to "Use Club from Resolver", then both Sims must be in that Club. If the club type is set to "Use Any Club", then there must be one club both the subject Sim and this Sim are in.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The Sim to test against for a common Club. If a multi-Sim participant is specified, the union of their clubs is considered, i.e. the test passes if at least one Sim satisfies the requirements.

TunableVariant.name: required_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this test will only pass if the group has a number of members that passes the tuned threshold.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The member requirement for this test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: room_for_new_members
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either have room for new members or not have room for new members.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either have room for new members or not have room for new members.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose Club status to check.

TunableVariant.name: subject_can_join_more_clubs
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to be allowed to join more Clubs or not.
The maximum number of Clubs per Sim is set in club_tuning.ClubTunables in the "MAX_CLUBS_PER_SIM" tunable.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to be allowed to join more Clubs or not.
The maximum number of Clubs per Sim is set in club_tuning.ClubTunables in the "MAX_CLUBS_PER_SIM" tunable.

TunableVariant.name: subject_passes_membership_criteria
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either pass this associated Club's membership criteria or not pass the membership criteria.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either pass this associated Club's membership criteria or not pass the membership criteria.

TunableVariant.name: subject_relationship_with_leader
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the tuned subject is required to have a specific relationship with the leader. If the subject and the leader match, the test fails.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by a relationship status.

Tunable.name: invert_num_relations
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check that your Num Relations is less than or equal to the value rather than the other way around.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on.

TunableVariant.name: test_incest
TunableVariant.description: Test for incest status. Test passes if this matches the two Sim's incest status.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: If set, the test will use the relationship score between sims for this track. If unset, the track defaults to the global module tunable REL_INSPECTOR_TRACK.

TunableTuple.name: filter
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that checks to see if a sim matches a given filter.

Tunable.name: duration_available
Tunable.description: The duration from now that will be used for the start and end time of the filter request.

TunableVariant.name: threshold_matched
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, we will require the number of Sims that match the filter pass the threshold requirement. Otherwise we require all Sims that the filter runs on to match.
This is useful if you only need one or a number of Sims to match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A threshold of how many sims should match the filter.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold for how many Sims should match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: gender_preference
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests whether the actor and the subject Sim have compatible genders and gender preferences.

Tunable.name: fallback_if_no_perference_is_set
Tunable.display: Fallback If No Perference Is Set
Tunable.description: If checked then if no gender preference is set for the sim we will still pass if it is a heterosexual connection.

TunableVariant.name: override_target_gender_test
TunableVariant.description: Required gender to test against as the target gender.

TunableEnum.name: test_specific_gender
TunableEnum.description: Required gender to test against as the target gender.

TunableTuple.name: mood
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if a Sim has the requested mood.

Tunable.name: disallow
Tunable.description: If True, this test will pass if the Sim's mood does NOT match the tuned mood reference.

Tunable.name: mood
Tunable.description: The mood that must be active (or must be inactive, if 'Disallow' is checked).

TunableTuple.name: motive
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that checks one or many statistics against a threshold.

TunableList.name: stats
TunableList.description: The stat we are operating on.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: relationship
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by a relationship status.

Tunable.name: invert_num_relations
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check that your Num Relations is less than or equal to the value rather than the other way around.

Tunable.name: num_relations
Tunable.description:
Number of Sims with specified relationships required to pass, default(0) is all known relations.
If value set to 1 or greater, then test is looking at least that number of relationship to match the criteria.
If value is set to 0, then test will pass if relationships being tested must match all criteria of the test to succeed. For example, if interaction should not appear if any relationship contains a relationship bit, this value should be 0.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on.

TunableVariant.name: test_incest
TunableVariant.description: Test for incest status. Test passes if this matches the two Sim's incest status.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: If set, the test will use the relationship score between sims for this track. If unset, the track defaults to the global module tunable REL_INSPECTOR_TRACK.

TunableTuple.name: relative_statistic
TunableTuple.description:
A Test that compares statistics against each other either on the same participant or on two different participants. I.E. I want this to pass only when the actor has lower hunger than the target. I.E. I want this to pass only when the targets's hunger is lower than their bladder.
If either of the Sims doesn't have the stat being compared the value will default to the initial value of the stat, or in the case that rank is being used, then the initial rank will be used.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value. The test passes if (source_stat comparison target)

Tunable.name: difference
Tunable.description: The difference between the source and target stat in order to pass the threshold. This value is added to the source stat value and the threshold is checked against the resulting value.

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: Use the raw points for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: Use the rank value for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: user_value
TunableTuple.description: Use the user value for the comparison in the test.

Tunable.name: highest_level_reached_instead
Tunable.description: If checked this will test against the highest level reached. This currently only works with Ranked Statistics. Other statistics do not have a notion of highest level reached. If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The stat we are using for the comparison

TunableList.name: target_stats
TunableList.description: The stat on the target we want to compare against. If there is more than one, all must pass the comparison. If there is none, it compares the same stat.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: sim_info
TunableTuple.description: The SimInfo tests some of the basic aspects of a Sim, such as their age, gender, or species.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: can_age_up
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

Tunable.name: specified
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableVariant.name: has_been_played
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableVariant.name: is_active_sim
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description:
When testing multiple participants if MATCH_ALL is set, then all the participants need to pass the test.
If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass as soon as one of them meet the criteria

TunableVariant.name: npc
TunableVariant.description:
Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.
Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.
Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

TunableTuple.name: specified
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableTuple.name: specified_extended
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableTuple.name: situation_job
TunableTuple.description: Require the tuned participant to have a specific situation job. If multiple participants, ALL participants must have the required job to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then the test result will be reversed, so it will test to see if they are not in a job or not in role state that has matching tags.

TunableList.name: role_tags
TunableList.description: The participant must have a job that matches the role_tags or have the situation_job.

TunableList.name: situation_jobs
TunableList.description: The participant must have this job in this list or a job that matches the role_tags.

TunableTuple.name: skill_tag
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that checks the TAGS of ALL THE PARTICIPANTS SKILLS each against a threshold.

Tunable.name: skill_quantity
Tunable.description: The minimum number of skills at or above this level required to pass.

TunableEnum.name: skill_tag
TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableTuple.name: skill_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold level to test of each skill.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: test_only_changed_skill
Tunable.description: If checked then we will only test the skill that actually changed.

TunableTuple.name: statistic
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether or not a statistic is at a certain threshold for a given participant. It can also test whether or not the participant has the statistic explicitly added on them.

Tunable.name: must_have_stat
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sim actually has the statistic referenced. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sim had the statistic at the value of 0

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: Use the raw points for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: Use the rank value for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: user_value
TunableTuple.description: Use the user value for the comparison in the test.

Tunable.name: highest_level_reached_instead
Tunable.description: If checked this will test against the highest level reached. This currently only works with Ranked Statistics. Other statistics do not have a notion of highest level reached. If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The stat we are operating on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableTuple.name: state_value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The state threshold for this test.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: topic
TunableTuple.description: Gate topics of the actor or target Sim.

TunableList.name: blacklist_topics
TunableList.description: The Sim cannot have any topic contained in this list to pass this test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_topics
TunableList.description: The Sim must have any topic in this list to pass this test.

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description: Test to require a Sim to have or not have certain specific traits.

Tunable.name: apply_thresholds_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description:
If checked then Num Whitelist Required and Num Blacklist Allowed will be applied to each individual participant from the subject. If unchecked then it will apply the values to the total whitelist and blacklist matches on the group.
IMPORTANT!!! In the case of objectives this should probably be set to false since we know that this is coming from only one sim and that we want to use the value that comes out of the test result numeric. This isn't just locked to being this value since there are valid cases within that system when you are looking at a group of sims and could want to test that one of your sims passes. Ex. Having a ghost sim in the household.

TunableList.name: blacklist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to not have traits of these types to pass this test. Should Num Blacklist Allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

TunableList.name: blacklist_traits
TunableList.description: The is required to not have traits from this list in order to pass this test. Should num_blacklist_allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

Tunable.description: A blacklist trait.

Tunable.name: num_blacklist_allowed
Tunable.description: The threshold of blacklist traits owned by the specified Sim that will trigger a test failure.

Tunable.name: num_whitelist_required
Tunable.description: The number of whitelist traits that the specified Sim is required to have in order to pass this test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits with these types in order to pass the test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_traits
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits from this list in order to pass the test.

Tunable.description: A whitelist trait. Please note: for pack-safe entries that are not loaded, the game will behave as if the entry doesn't exist. This allows you to specify a pack trait and required count of 1 and always fail the test should the appropriate pack not be installed.
